result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:20 AM Defendant Floyd F. Edgerly appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. FE has received the complaint. FE doesn't qualify for a public defender and is trying to work with an attorney out of Madison. Court asks who the attorney is that he is trying to speak. FE states Brian Severson. Court speaks about dean appointment.   Court reviews financial information and appoints Attorney Steven Richards. Defendant to deposit $50/month with the Clerk of Court starting on 04/01/22 . At the end of the case, counsel will file their bill and the Defendant will be required to fully reimburse Richland County. The Defendant will need to complete a payment plan form with the Clerk of Court.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

02:48 PM Defendant Floyd F. Edgerly appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court reset due to him being out of the jail. FE comments about getting an attorney. Judge Rood advises FE to speak with Judge Sharp about that.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
